comments:
I20040518 08:16
No changes have been releaseed to help for a week, but in this build
 stand-alone help test logs exceptions
 and Infocenter fails to start.
This only appears when running from releng automated test framework, they pass 
when running from workspace.

The standalone help that is launched and closed first and the log in the 
workspace contains:

The stand-alone help test does not pass any locale, but the infocenter passes -
nl pl_PL to the eclipse when launching.

I am not sure what the problem is, but it looks like locale is influcencing 
behavior of the runtime.

I failed to reproduce this by launching multiple Eclipse instances from 
command line.  Is it possible that some (transient) environment setting is 
inheritted from Eclipse running junit by Eclipse running stand-alone help, and 
cause it to fail?

Konrad, I am able to reproduce this with 2.1 plugins (no <?eclipse
version="3.0"?>) that don't have a plugin.properties. Is that the case with the
plugins you are trying to install?

help test plug-in is a 3.0 plug-in and has plugin-properties, but stand-alone 
and infocenter are launched as another eclipse instance.  We pass -data and -
application but nothing for configuraiton.  The configuration is the same as 
one running all JUnit test, which means all Eclipse plug-ins and all JUnit 
test plug-ins are installed.  It is certainly possible that some test plug-ins 
are 2.0.

I just installed OptimizeIt plug-in (which is to 2.0 specs) in my development 
Eclipse and started noticing MissingResourceException in the log, so you are 
probably right.

Original summary: "java.util.MissingResourceException Exceptions/failures in
stand-alone help tests." 

ResourceTranslator.getResourceBundle fails for 2.1 plugins with no
plugin.properties. The outcome is that although they are installed in the
framework, they are not added to the registry.
*** Bug 62767 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
This is very important to be fixed from the Ant integration perspective.

This must be fixed for M9. Pascal/Rafael, please address with highest 
priority.  I suspect that it is something to do with the agressive registry 
localization that recently went in.  Or perhaps the extension points fixup 
code...
Actually, I will fix this for the build tonight...

Temporary fix to ResourceTranslator released into the M9 candidate build for 
tonight.

The problem was a MissingResourceException that was being thrown when you had a 
2.1 plugin without a plugin.properties file.  I changed it to catch the 
exception and return null.  This is reasonable since there is no requirement 
for plugin.properties to be present.

The fix is incomplete as the code assumed/s that the resource file is called 
plugin.properties.  For 2.1 fragments it should be fragment.properties I think.

Assigning to Pascal as he is in this code fixing up the early translation of 
the registry...  Lowering the priority but leaving for M9.  We want the new 
registry code working in M9

Is there a build tonight? I thought the last candidate build was at 8pm EST
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/~checkout~/platform-releng-
home/buildSchedule.html

The caveat with the solution given is that it breaks the API for
IPlugin#getResourceBundle (which says it will throw MissingResourceException if
there is no resource bundle). I would say the fix should go on
EclipseBundleListener, since all callers of ResourceTranslator.getResourceBundle
other than the EclipseBundleListener seem to be prepared to handle
MissingResourceExceptions.

Reopening for consideration.
